cyclone.name: CINDY
cyclone.current_location: about 170 miles SSW of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest toward the southwest Louisiana–southeast Texas coast, then forecast to turn north and move inland across Arkansas and into the lower Ohio Valley
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Louisiana-Texas border (southwest Louisiana / southeastern Texas coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: San Luis Pass, Texas to the Alabama-Florida border, including Metropolitan New Orleans and Lake Pontchartrain
weather_observation.warning_coast: San Luis Pass, Texas to the Alabama-Florida border, including Metropolitan New Orleans and Lake Pontchartrain
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from the central Texas coast to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: None – only occasional breezy conditions possible as remnants pass inland well west of the port
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate rain (around 1–2 inches) possible late week from remnant moisture, but heavy totals not expected
weather_observation.other_hazards: Low-end threat of isolated inland tornadoes cannot be ruled out but probability is very low for the Virginia port area
